page.title: 14Pitsford Water
page.content: Construction started in 1952 and was completed in 1956.This reservoir supplies the{water needs}for Daventry, Northampton and Weedon.It has an area of 3 square kilometres and holds about 18 million square metres of water. Chlorine is introduced into the water as a disenfectant. The Anglian Water Authority aims to develop the area's potential as a recreation centre during future years, despite some{local protests.}It is believed that this will be a facility in increasing demand as the people of the 1980's find themselves enjoying an increase in leisure}time. Pitsford Water is already a{popular {centre}for trout fishing and a sailing club makes regular use of the reservoir. Picnic sites and car-parks have been established near Pitsford and Holcot villages.
